div.h4: For the latest information on COVID-19, visit our Coronavirus Update page.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;

span.span: Per the Governor’s Proclamation, school buildings will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 academic school year. Please be assured that the Algiers Charter’s administration and faculty have been preparing for this possibility and have implemented plans to ensure continuity of learning.

p.span: Algiers Charter limited technology and hotspot distribution will take place on Thursday, April 23, 2020. All technology devices will be distributed at Martin Behrman's main entrance (2832 General Meyer Avenue), including for students that attend Landry-Walker High School.

Parents must be on the pickup list in order to receive a device for their child. To pick up a laptop or hotspot device, parents will be required to provide the student’s name and parent/guardian driver's license to the administrator, who will verify the child’s legal guardian’s information.
Families can pull into the emergency lane/carpool line and remain in their vehicle during the pickup times below.
*Students attending Landry-Walker must pick up devices at Martin Behrman.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;
font-size: 14pt; background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;

span.span: The Spring Break holiday is April 10-17, 2020. Teachers and students will resume at-home learning on Monday, April 20, 2020.

br.a: Click here for Landry-Walker parent letter_4_8_20

span.style: font-size: 14pt; background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;
background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;
background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;

span.span: : Meals for both Thursday and Friday will be served on Thursday, March 26 from 9 a.m. – 12 p.m.

span.style: background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;
background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;

span.span: Community Feeding Sites will NOT be open on Friday, March 27.

span.style: background-color: inherit; color: inherit; font-family: inherit;

span.span: Starting on Monday, March 30 – every Monday, meals will be provided for two days.
Every Wednesday, meals will be provided for three days.
Moving forward Community Feeding sites will NOT be open on Tuesday, Thursday or Friday.
Families wishing to access information on child nutrition resources should visit the District’s webpage at
. This webpage has the most up-to-date listing of where food services are available.

p.span: As we prepare to transition to at-home learning, we are providing paperwork packets and online assignments in a variety of online programs. All of our students have access to iReady (K-8) and Study Island (2-8) and will be able to work through their grade-level standards digitally if access is available. Our teachers will continue to communicate and support our students and families through DOJO, phone calls and emails. We will continue to explore other software such as Google Classroom and Zoom as we continue to refine our at-home learning plan.

We are currently preparing our teachers, students, and community for at-home learning for our Landry-Walker students. For the week of March 16th, 2020, we have provided academic work packets for each student from their respective teachers. Our teachers will continue to communicate and support students and parents through phone calls and emails. Our teachers will be in communication with you to provide students their Google Classroom credentials.
If you have any additional questions or concerns about the Coronavirus, please contact the following:
If you have an Algiers Charter related question, please contact our offices via phone or email:

span.span: This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

br.span: Our social workers will provide support to students during this difficult time. If you need support, please reach out to our social workers via email:

p.span: The CDC recommends the following actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory illnesses such as the common cold, flu, and the Coronavirus:

span.strong: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60 percent alcohol.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you or your child is sick and remain home until fever-free for 24 hours without fever-reducing medication.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
